result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:31 pm cases 21CF1313, 22CF413, 22CF421 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Ryan A. Ford appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Ryan A. Ford.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF413, 22CF421: Defendant waives right to a Preliminary Hearing and Court accepts waiver. Thirty days for the State to file the information in both files. 
An ARGN in 22CF413, 22CF421 and a STC in 21CF1313 is scheduled for 12/22/22 at 4:00 pm (zoom).

(Cases 21CF1313, 22CF413, 22CF421 are called at 10:31 AM- by Zoom)  Defendant Ryan A. Ford appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for Ryan A. Ford.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense recently appointed- requests adjournment. 
Status Conference in 21CF1313 and Hearing in 22CF413, 22CF421: 10/27/2022 at 2:30 PM.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases called at 11:31 AM - 22CF421, 22CF413, and 21CF1313)
Defendant Ryan A. Ford in court with Attorney Roger Hillestad.  Attorney Monica Fallon appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hillestad discovered a conflict of interest in 22CF413 - will need to withdraw.  Attorney Hillestad to submit a substitution of attorney form and to contact the Public Defender Office for a new appointment on these cases.  
Status Conference: July 14, 2022 at 3:00 PM
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with Midwest Home Supply or Charter Bank.
No contact with co-defendants: Glynn Garnett, Natasha Knudtson, Karyn Ward, Richard Horde & Morgin Lawrence. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF413, 22CF421)

9:27 AM Cases called: 21CF1313, 22CF413 & 22CF421. Defendant Ryan A. Ford in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Ryan A. Ford.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF413 & 22CF421: Waives reading of the complaint, time limits for preliminary hearing are waived and bond is set. 

21CF1313: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 

Parties referred to JA for scheduling as Attorney Hillestad has not been officially appointed on the new cases.
